alert.note: Alert for Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 10:39AM EDT until April 11 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties. North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Newberry, Saluda and Greenwood Counties. Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting Edgefield and McCormick Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg. * WHEN...From late Thursday night to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Some minor flooding occurs along the boardwalk at Edisto Gardens. Downstream from the Highway 301 bridge, some roads off Chiquita street near the river begin to flood. At 10.0 feet, Farmland and lowlands along Highway 301 near Orangeburg become flooded at stages above 10 ft. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 6.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning to a crest of 8.2 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EDT.
